other_tests.findings: Normal size of the left side of the heart and normal left ventricular function. Right side of the heart indicated an estimated right ventricular systolic pressure of 52 mm Hg with right atrial and right ventricular dilation and moderate global right ventricular hypokinesis.
Demonstrated an enlargement of the right atrium and right ventricle consistent with right-sided heart failure.
Diagnosis of a moderate obstructive ventilatory defect (forced expiratory volume at 1 second, 59% predicted) with preserved diffusing capacity.
Right atrial pressure 16 mm Hg; right ventricular pressure 53/12 mm Hg; pulmonary artery pressure 53/16 mm Hg with mean pulmonary artery pressure of 30 mm Hg; elevated cardiac output at 9.25 L/min.
Confirmed the communication between the left atrium and the superior vena cava, which was identified during surgery.
Showed decreased right ventricular size with the Dacron patch visible in the posterior right atrium.
Patient reported substantial improvement in functional class; participation in moderate-level aerobic exercise.
